Package Underground

Class Metro

java.lang.Object
Superclass.Vehicle
WheeledVehicle.WheeledTransportation
Locomotive.Train
Underground.Metro
Direct Known Subclasses:
Tram
public class Metro
extends Train
The Metro class is designed to contain the most basic attributes/methods which any metro vehicle should possess.
Author:
Kevin Courey

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private int numOfStops
    Stores the number of stops between the metro's starting and destinations stations.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Metro()
    This method constructs a metro vehicle with a default number of wheels, maximum speed, number of vehicles, starting and destination stations and number of stops.
    Metro​(int numOfWheels, double maxSpeed, int numOfVehicles, java.lang.String startingStation, java.lang.String destinationStation, int numOfStops)
    This method constructs a metro vehicle with a specified number of wheels, maximum speed, number of vehicles, starting and destination stations and number of stops.
    Metro​(Metro otherMetro)
    This method constructs a copy of a pre-existing metro vehicle.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Metro copy()
    This method overrides the copy method in the base class (Vehicle) and returns a copy of the Vehicle that invokes this method.
    boolean equals​(java.lang.Object otherObject)
    This method compares two objects and determines whether or not they are of type Metro and share the same contents.
    int getNumOfStops()
    This method retrieves the number of stops the metro has to make.
    void setNumOfStops​(int numOfStops)
    This method sets the number of stops the metro has to make.
    java.lang.String toString()
    This method returns a description of the vehicle, with regard to the number of wheels it has, its maximum speed, the number of vehicles which it is composed of and its starting and destination stations.

    Methods inherited from class Locomotive.Train

    getDestinationStation, getNumOfVehicles, getStartingStation, setDestinationStation, setNumOfVehicles, setStartingStation

    Methods inherited from class WheeledVehicle.WheeledTransportation

    getMaxSpeed, getNumOfWheels, setMaxSpeed, setNumOfWheels

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Metro

      public Metro()
      This method constructs a metro vehicle with a default number of wheels, maximum speed, number of vehicles, starting and destination stations and number of stops.

    • Metro

      public Metro​(int numOfWheels, double maxSpeed, int numOfVehicles, java.lang.String startingStation, java.lang.String destinationStation, int numOfStops)
      This method constructs a metro vehicle with a specified number of wheels, maximum speed, number of vehicles, starting and destination stations and number of stops.
      Parameters:
      numOfWheels - The number of wheels.
      maxSpeed - The maximum speed.
      numOfVehicles - The number of vehicles.
      startingStation - The starting station.
      destinationStation - The destination station.
      numOfStops - The number of stops.

      This method constructs a copy of a pre-existing metro vehicle.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      This method returns a description of the vehicle, with regard to the number of wheels it has, its maximum speed, the number of vehicles which it is composed of and its starting and destination stations.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Train
      Returns:
      Vehicle description regarding the number of wheels it has, its maximum speed, the number of vehicles which it is composed of, its starting and destination stations and the number of stops it has to make.

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object otherObject)
      This method compares two objects and determines whether or not they are of type Metro and share the same contents.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Train
      Parameters:
      otherObject - Any object.
      Returns:
      True if the objects are of type Metro and share the same contents and False if at least one of these conditions is not met.
